Derrick Rose has been named NBA Player of the Month for November.
Udonis Haslem (foot surgery) said he is targeting April for his return.
Magic guard J.J. Redick (stomach virus) is 50-50 at best for Friday's game.
Lakers signed second-round F Devin Ebanks.
The Thunder recalled rookie Cole Aldrich from the D-League on Monday.
Cavaliers coach Byron Scott is considering sweeping lineup changes in light of his team's recent struggles.
Xavier Henry has supplanted O.J. Mayo as the Grizzlies' starting shooting guard.
Byron Scott is reportedly thinking about changing the starting lineup for the Cavaliers, but gave no hints as to what he might do.
Eric Bledsoe will start at PG for Monday's game against the Kings, and Baron Davis will come off the bench.
According to Rick Carlisle, Shawn Marion should be okay for Wednesday's game after playing just 15 minutes on Tuesday.
Tracy McGrady (leg soreness) told reporters that he is good to go for Sunday's game against the Knicks.
Shaun Livingston (knee) went through a full practice Tuesday and will play in the season opener.
Amir Johnson is expected to start at PF for the Raptors with Reggie Evans sidelined, but backup big man Joey Dorsey could also help fill the void.
Andray Blatche is a late scratch for Tuesday's game due to a hip contusion, and Yi Jianlian will start in his place.
Ron Artest said on Friday that he isn't bothered by his limited playing time this season, at just 27 minutes per game.
